revised_title: Preserving Ships from Worm Infestation: A Review of Proposed Solutions
tldr: This article discusses the problem of shipworm infestation in ships returning from the Indies and various proposed solutions. Some suggest using harder wood, others propose using a bitter wood like the Indian Pear-tree, while others believe a lixivium could be used to impart the desired qualities to ordinary wood. A London-based individual also suggests using pitch from sea coals as a remedy.
